Key Match Events: Kawhi Leonard appeared in his first game of the season in the Los Angeles Clippers' 131-105 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.
Norm Powell led the Clippers with 20 points.
Eight Clippers players scored in double figures.
Post-Match Reflections: Kawhi Leonard expressed that playing for the first time in 253 days was the 'easy part' and emphasized the difficulty of not playing and having to rehab.
Coach Ty Lue mentioned that Leonard's presence on the floor makes it easier for everybody else and highlighted the importance of Leonard continuing to build off his performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kawhi Leonard received a warm reception in his first game at the Clippers' $2-billion Intuit Dome.
Leonard played just 3:36 in the second half due to a minutes restriction.
